info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 7 at 8:50PM EDT until July 9 at 3:38AM EDT by NWS Raleigh NC
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina...
Cape Fear River At Lillington affecting Harnett County.
.The river has crested just above 17 ft this afternoon.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Cape Fear River at Lillington.
* WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Action stage. The Cape Fear River reaches bankfull. At 14.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. The boat launch ramp and wooden deck at Mermaid Point Restaurant are flooded. At 17.0 feet, Water threatens homes upstream on Riverside Hills Drive. At 19.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins. The storm drains on the north bank are inundated and water reaches the water treatment plant. Homes on Riverside Hills Drive are flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:28 PM EDT Monday the stage was 16.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 17.6 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon to 7.0 feet Friday morning. It will rise to 7.2 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.4 feet on 10/09/2016. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers.
The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning.Tuesday morning.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING
